item.title: Japan Government Watching Currency Movements Closely
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said his government wouldn’t rule out any measures in dealing with foreign-exchange rates.

item.title: The Costco Shoppers Putting $2,000 Gold Bars in Their Carts
item.description: Young investors say the old-school store of value is a hedge against inflation and catastrophe.

item.title: Oil Is Hitting Its Highest Level in Months---Just in Time for Summer Driving Season
item.description: Brent crude futures, the benchmark, have climbed 16% in 2024 to just under $90 a barrel, a level last breached in late October.

item.title: This Small-Cap Stock Index Has Some Jumbo-Size Tenants
item.description: The combined market value of Super Micro Computer and MicroStrategy—the two largest stocks in the Russell 2000—has swelled to $84 billion.

item.title: A Tiny Activist Fund Is Trying to Unseat Larry Fink
item.description: The proposal from Bluebell Capital to remove the BlackRock CEO as chairman faces long odds.

item.title: Stocks Drop After Fed Officials Cast Doubt on Rate Cuts
item.description: All 11 of the S&P 500’s sectors fall.

item.title: Your Financial Adviser Doesn't Want You to Know About These Conflicts
item.description: Fee-based advisers want to manage as much money as possible and sometimes recommend drawing Social Security early and holding on to mortgages.

item.title: What Does the Breadth of the Nasdaq's Bull Run Tell Us? To Be Wary
item.description: “Market breadth” indicators suggest the tech-heavy index’s rally could be losing steam.

item.title: Banks Are Extending Office Loans. Are They Also Pretending?
item.description: Many 2023 maturities were pushed into 2024, giving lenders more time for rates to drop and other investors to come in.

item.title: U.S. Refiners Still Have Gas in the Tank
item.description: Disruptions in the Red Sea are helping boost refined fuel prices globally, and U.S. refiners have a distinct advantage.

item.title: It Isn't Just AI: Economic Hype Is Also Infecting Stocks
item.description: Despite the focus on technology giants, “cyclical” sectors have staged a less-conspicuous rally and are trading at stretched valuations.

item.title: 3 Ways to Lock In Lower Mortgage Rates
item.description: With affordability expected to remain challenging for home buyers, experts say there are ways to ease the pain.

item.title: The British Are Coming for Your White-Collar Job
item.description: American businesses are sending all types of work across the Atlantic, drawn by depressed U.K. salaries, tax incentives and a weak currency.

item.title: Apple Isn't Making an EV, but Chinese Phone Makers Are Showing They Can
item.description: The tech heavyweights looking to electric vehicles for their second act are jumping into a brutal price war.

item.title: Tech Glitch Upends Financial Aid for About a Million Students
item.description: Inaccurate tax data could cost some students aid, though others might benefit from the error.

item.title: S&P 500 Snaps Two-Day Losing Streak
item.description: Powell says a strong economy hasn’t changed Fed’s expectation that interest rate cuts will be warranted later this year.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Rose by 3.2 Million Barrels Last Week
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories unexpectedly rose last week, and stocks of gasoline and diesel decreased more than expected while refinery capacity use slipped.

item.title: We're Old, Retired---and Apparently Invisible
item.description: In recent years, it seems that young people don’t even see us. Are we imagining things?

item.title: Lender Blue Owl Capital Pushes Into Insurance
item.description: One of Wall Street’s fastest-growing firms is buying Kuvare Asset Management in a deal that will boost assets under management by $20 billion.

item.title: Google Is More Resilient Than Its AI Stumbles Imply
item.description: Google’s stock has lagged behind other tech giants even as its search business proves resilient to AI incursions.
